fullText: Ms. Peters gives a performance of stupendous technical accomplishment, one that captures not merely the mannerisms but the essence of Judy Garland's tragic persona.

bwwExcerpt: Mr. Lauria, whom TV viewers will remember from "The Wonder Years," knows a dream part when he sees one, and makes the most of this one. He plays Mr. Lombardi like a warmer but comparably tough version of George C. Scott's Patton, and lurking beneath the buzzsaw bluster of his win-or-else tirades is ...
